_source.text: A 1960 newspaper article mentioning the breaking of the blacklist ends with a rebuttal by Ronald Reagan, who says that the Communists weren't bad because of the scripts they wrote, but for their subversion behind the scenes, in the guilds, etc. Stanley Kramer put forward an angry defense of Young for Inherit the Wind , stating there was no content in the film that he as producer didn't want there, and that his critics better not dictate to him how to do business, because this wasn't Russia.
